  1. Oxford 3000
  2. Oxford 24

Words 2301-2400

  1. score
    She was happy to score the winning goal in the game.

  2. scream
    I heard a loud scream coming from the other room.

  3. screen
    The movie was shown on a large screen in the theater.

  4. script
    The actor memorized his lines from the script.

  5. sculpture
    The museum displayed a beautiful sculpture made of stone.

  6. sea
    We spent the day swimming in the clear blue sea.

  7. search
    They began a search for the missing keys.

  8. season
    Spring is my favorite season of the year.

  9. seat
    Please take a seat while you wait.

  10. second1
    She finished the race in second place.

  11. secondary
    The secondary goal is to improve communication.

  12. secondly
    Firstly, we need to plan; secondly, we need to act.

  13. secret
    She told me a secret that I promised not to share.

  14. secretary
    The secretary scheduled the meeting for next week.

  15. section
    This section of the book is very interesting.

  16. sector
    The technology sector is growing rapidly.

  17. secure
    Make sure to secure the door before leaving.

  18. security
    The airport has strict security measures in place.

  19. see
    I can see the mountains from my window.

  20. seed
    She planted a seed in the garden.

  21. seek
    They decided to seek advice from an expert.

  22. seem
    It does not seem like a good idea to me.

  23. select
    Please select a book from the shelf.

  24. selection
    The store has a wide selection of fruits.

  25. self
    She is learning to believe in herself.

  26. sell
    They decided to sell their old car.

  27. send
    I will send you an email with the details.

  28. senior
    He is a senior member of the team.

  29. sense
    She has a strong sense of responsibility.

  30. sensible
    It is sensible to save money for the future.

  31. sensitive
    He is very sensitive to criticism.

  32. sentence
    Write a sentence using this word.

  33. separate
    They decided to separate the tasks into smaller parts.

  34. September
    School usually starts in September.

  35. sequence
    The events happened in a logical sequence.

  36. series
    I enjoy watching this series on television.

  37. serious
    This is a serious problem that needs attention.

  38. seriously
    She takes her work very seriously.

  39. servant
    The servant cleaned the house every morning.

  40. serve
    They serve breakfast at 8 a.m.

  41. service
    The restaurant is known for its excellent service.

  42. session
    The training session lasted for two hours.

  43. set
    She set the table for dinner.

  44. setting
    The story takes place in a rural setting.

  45. settle
    They decided to settle in a small town.

  46. seven
    There are seven days in a week.

  47. seventeen
    She turned seventeen last month.

  48. seventy
    The book costs seventy dollars.

  49. several
    I have visited several countries in Europe.

  50. severe
    The storm caused severe damage to the area.

  51. sex
    The form asks for your name, age, and sex.

  52. sexual
    The movie explores themes of love and sexual identity.

  53. shade
    We sat under the shade of a large tree.

  54. shadow
    His shadow stretched across the ground.

  55. shake
    Please shake the bottle before opening it.

  56. shall
    Shall we go for a walk this evening?

  57. shallow
    The water in the pool is shallow at this end.

  58. shame
    It is a shame that they could not attend the event.

  59. shape
    The cookies were cut into the shape of stars.

  60. share
    She decided to share her lunch with a friend.

  61. sharp
    Be careful, the knife is very sharp.

  62. she
    She is reading a book in the garden.

  63. sheep
    The farmer owns a flock of sheep.

  64. sheet
    He wrote his notes on a sheet of paper.

  65. shelf
    The books are neatly arranged on the shelf.

  66. shell
    She found a beautiful shell on the beach.

  67. shelter
    They took shelter from the rain under a tree.

  68. shift
    The workers are on the night shift this week.

  69. shine
    The sun began to shine through the clouds.

  70. shiny
    The car looked shiny after it was washed.

  71. ship
    The ship sailed across the ocean.

  72. shirt
    He wore a blue shirt to the meeting.

  73. shock
    The news came as a shock to everyone.

  74. shocked
    She was shocked by the sudden announcement.

  75. shoe
    He bought a new pair of running shoes.

  76. shoot
    The hunter aimed to shoot the target.

  77. shooting
    The shooting of the film took several months.

  78. shop
    She went to the shop to buy some groceries.

  79. shopping
    They spent the afternoon shopping for clothes.

  80. short
    The meeting was short but productive.

  81. shot
    He took a shot at the basketball hoop.

  82. should
    You should try to get some rest.

  83. shoulder
    He carried the bag over his shoulder.

  84. shout
    She had to shout to be heard over the noise.

  85. show
    The teacher asked her to show her work.

  86. shower
    He took a quick shower before leaving.

  87. shut
    Please shut the door behind you.

  88. shy
    She is too shy to speak in front of the class.

  89. sick
    He stayed home because he was feeling sick.

  90. side
    They walked along the side of the road.

  91. sight
    The sight of the mountains was breathtaking.

  92. sign
    He asked her to sign the document.

  93. signal
    The traffic light turned green, giving the signal to go.

  94. significant
    This discovery is significant for medical research.

  95. significantly
    The new policy significantly improved the situation.

  96. silence
    The room fell into complete silence.

  97. silent
    She remained silent during the discussion.

  98. silk
    The dress was made of soft silk.

  99. silly
    He made a silly mistake during the test.

  100. silver
    She wore a necklace made of silver.
